label: Description
value: Two peasants dancing. The woman, facing the spectator, moves toward the right. The man, his back turned, lifts his left hand.

label: Description
value: A bust portrait of a man, seen almost in profile, facing right.

label: Description
value: A woman, dressed in clothing from the 1890s, reclines in a wicker chair, a table with still life behind her. Another table with a tea pot and cup is lightly sketched in graphite, lower left.

label: Physical description
value: Brush and watercolor, graphite on illustration board

label: Description
value: Fragment of blue-green silk, showing portion of painted design; large scale group of grapes, leaves, and peony painted in shades of red, vermillion, yellow, violet. At lower left appears tail of a bird, one leg and claw clutched to stem. Bird's back is green, breast white and rose, leg vermillion.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: printed then painted

label: Description
value: Rectangular fragment of cream-colored cotton in a large-scale floral pattern. Original colors were red, blue, violet and brown, but a large section is primarily brown with a small section on the left-hand side showing original colors.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton Technique: block printed on plain weave

label: Description
value: Standing figure of a woman wearing a striped dress and a large bonnet, carrying a band box in her left hand and another box under the right arm.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Katherine Strong Welman

label: Description
value: Cartoon or illustration. Exterior scene. A woman stands at left, holding an infant in her left arm, while her right hand holds an umbrella. Another woman stands at right, holding a basket on her left arm.

label: Credit line
value: Museum purchase through gift of Katherine Strong Welman

label: Description
value: Heavy floral and scroll design of which only a portion is included in this fragment. A bead molding at top. Printed in brown. Adhering to back is brown wood grain paper which probably was used for sidewall.

label: Provenance
value: From the Usher's Room at the White House.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of the Commission of Renovation of the Executive Mansion

label: Description
value: Sash with a broad band of checkered squares in two shades of tan on either side of thin stripes in the center, also in shades of tan. Knotted warp fringe at one end.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound weave

label: Description
value: Length of fine cream-colored linen has a small bird's eye pattern. Hemmed at ends.

label: Description
value: Envelope-shaped purse or letter case of faded red silk with woven design in silver. Back and front, fountain with large flowers at sides. Border of zigzag and pointed shapes. Flap has symmetrical foliage decoration. Edged with narrow silver braid. Lined with pink taffeta.

label: Description
value: Small envelope-shaped case. Very faded and soiled rose color with a woven design in silver. Symmetrical stylized design of flowers and foliage. Lined with cream white taffeta. Has been edged with very narrow silver braid which remains under one flap.

label: Description
value: Letter case of blue silk taffeta embroidered with straw in a symmetrical floral design. Fiber is couched flat, twisted and braided. Worked as a single panel; lined with tan silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk and straw embroidery on silk foundation Technique: couched flat, twisted and braided plant stem material on plain weave foundation

label: Description
value: Flat purse with a drawstring top; one face has a bouquet of flowers, the other a basket of flowers. The sides and top are decorated with a deep edging of fruit, flowers, and animals, including a camel. In polychrome silks over white satin. An example of a type of needle knotting called oya, practiced in the Eastern Mediterranean.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, wire; silk lining Technique: needle knotting (bebilla or oya), silk satin lining Label: silk needle knotting (bebilla or oya), silk satin lining

label: Notes
value: Flat purse with a drawstring top; one face has a bouquet of flowers, the other a basket of flowers. The sides and top are decorated with a deep edging of fruit, flowers, and animals, including a camel. In polychrome silks over white satin. An example of a type of needle knotting called oya, practiced in the Eastern Mediterranean.

label: Description
value: Drawstring bag with large metal tassel at bottom. Diagonal bands of white netting separated by bands of metallic purl. Bebilla flowers and fruit applied along netting and in a deep border at the top.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic Technique: needle knotting (bebilla)

label: Description
value: Cream colored silk miser's purse with designs of flowers in cut steel beads.  Tassels are made from cut steel loops.  Single ring of steel, grooved ornament to fasten purse.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, steel Technique: embroidered netting

label: Description
value: Small purse in the form of a jug, in ombre stripes from brownish-red to white. With bronze-colored beads, a gilt ring at neck, and gilt drop at botton.

label: Description
value: Miser's purse worked in bebilla or oya with very small flowers and leaves on green mesh. Two covered rings as slides for purse.

label: Description
value: Small, egg-shaped case, flat on one side with a top of blue silk and metallic thread in a small stylized floral design. The back is faced with a fragment of patterned silk. Attached to this a small faded pink taffeta case with a drawstring closure. Case holds three pieces of bright red wool, probably for needles.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal, wool Technique: woven

label: Description
value: Narrow ribbon in pinks and greenin a repeated, small-scale striped pattern. Elaborate tassels at either end.

label: Description
value: Pair of suspenders of heavy silk mesh. Embroidered in colored silks in a vine design with small Chinese figures. Lined with magenta and white plaid taffeta. White leather straps and points to fashion to trousers.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, leather Technique: counted stitch embroidery

label: Description
value: Tall man's cap of brilliant yellow silk embroidered with floral vines in silver metallic yarns. Lower edge turns up in the bicorne style.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic (metal-wrapped silk-core yarn) Technique: embroidered in satin and stem stitches on plain weave foundation Label: silk embroidered in metallic yarns in satin and stem stitches

label: Description
value: Man's nightcap with a rounded crown and turned-up brim. The fabric has a green silk satin ground with a woven pattern of flowers and arabesques in cream silk. The brim uses a different section of the same fabric, patterned with rabbits, fruit, trees, and addorsed birds.  Touches of salmon and silver embroidery accent both areas.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic (silver metal foil wound onto white silk core) Technique: two interconnected structures of 4\1 satin and plain weave (lampas), embroidered in surface satin stitch Label: silk lampas, embroidered with silk and metallic yarns

label: Description
value: Cap of cream white cotton, made in four conical sections. Seams stitched in silver thread, joined at top with metal tassel. Embroidered with small-scale flower sprays in blue, white, and metal thread. Cuff embroidered in symmetrical pattern of pomegranate and foliage sprays.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, linen, silk, metallic Technique: embroidery

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 30 cm (11 13/16 in.) folded

label: Description
value: Cap of coral silk with a chenille tassel in the same color. Knit with altnernating bands in a simple goemetric patterns.

label: Description
value: Close fitting skull cap of pink silk net. Embroidered in pink silks. Very long elaborate tassel of strands of chenille in coral pink, made into a group of strands.

label: Description
value: Dark red knitted silk cap with diagonally ribbed body, and crown with a star-shaped area of varied knitting patterns. With very long ornament of silk cords and chenille, forming three lozenge shapes and terminating in two tassels.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: knitted cap, knotted tassel Label: Knitted silk with knotted chenille tassel

label: Description
value: Sheer square with embroidered border of alternating up and down repeat of floral sprays and basket. Larger basket with flowering sprays set inside this border at each corner. In multicolored pastel silks, tarnished silver thread. Scalloped edge embroidered in green silk.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk or pineapple fiber, metallic thread (silver metal on yellow silk core) Technique: embroidered on plain weave

label: Description
value: Woven openwork linen band wound with pink and white silk. Green silk floss foliage band down the center, dotted with buds of ribbon in shades of pink, white, dark purple and red.

label: Dimensions
value: H x W: 226 x 5 cm (7 ft. 5 in. x 1 15/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Diamond-shaped openwork band of loosely chained blue cords sewn with serpentines of colored knotted silk floss. Floral pompom of silk floss and silk cord centered in each scallop. Edging in scalloped white chenille.

label: Description
value: Buds and flowers made of ribbons and silk floss fastened closely to linen cord.
